etymologies: late Middle English (in the senses ‘deaden’ and ‘transfer (land) to a corporation in mortmain’): from Old French amortiss-, lengthened stem of amortir, based on Latin ad ‘to, at’ + mors, mort- ‘death’

definitions: gradually write off the initial cost of (an asset) over a period

examples.text: the vessel's owners could not amortize her high capital costs

shortDefinitions: gradually write off initial cost of asset over period

definitions: reduce or pay off (a debt) with regular payments

examples.text: eighty per cent of the proceeds has been used to amortize the public debt

shortDefinitions: reduce or pay off debt with regular payments

definitions: transfer (land) to a corporation in mortmain
shortDefinitions: transfer land to corporation in mortmain
